summary: The U.S. District Court for the Western District of Texas today entered a final judgment in favor of a Texas-based insurance company in a civil injunctive action brought by a jury in 2015.  The SEC's complaint, filed in federal court in Houston, alleges that American National Insurance Company (A.N.C.) violated the duty of good faith and fair dealing when it failed to pay Holland's extracontractual claims.  According to the complaint, American National falsely claimed that Holland was making a claim for both PIP and UIM benefits when, in fact, she was not.  In fact, the complaint alleges that the jury found that the insurer had no duty to pay the PIP benefits and that Holland did not intend to make a PIP or UIM claim at the time of the alleged failure to pay them.   The complaint further alleges that, based on the jury's findings, American N.C. violated its duty of fair dealing by failing to timely acknowledge Holland's claims and failing to reimburse her for her medical expenses under her PIP coverage.
